definition: to defeat/to damage/to lose (to an opponent)/to fail/to wither
to die/to lose/to be gone/to flee/deceased

sentences.english: Adversity causes some men to break; others to break records.
sentences.chinese: 困境导致一些人败亡，另一些人破纪录。

sentences.english: This suffers a defeat and flees the basic function to the Japanese Fascist.
sentences.chinese: 这对日本法西斯的败亡起着根本作用。

sentences.english: May those who say to me, 'Aha! Aha!' be appalled at their own shame.
sentences.chinese: 愿那些对我说，阿哈，阿哈的，因羞愧而败亡。

sentences.english: His eyes shall see his destruction, and he shall drink of the wrath of the Almighty.
sentences.chinese: 愿他亲眼看见自己败亡，亲自饮全能者的忿怒。

sentences.english: But they were his downfall and the downfall of all Israel.
sentences.chinese: 但那些神使他和以色列众人败亡了。

definition: to be destroyed/to become extinct/to perish/to die out/to destroy/to exterminate
(of a nation) to be destroyed/subjugation/vanquished nation
to execute all of sb's relatives (as punishment) (old)
to defeat/to inflict a defeat on sb
total defeat of an army (idiom); fig. a complete wipeout
extermination of an entire family (ancient Chinese punishment)
failed and wiped over the floor (idiom); to fail utterly/a crushing defeat/beaten and in a hopeless position
